message.content:
To align a row of divs to the right using flex in CSS, you can use the following code: ```css .container { display: flex; justify-content: flex-end; } .div { width: 100px; /* or any desired width */ height: 100px; /* or any desired height */ background-color: #ccc; /* or any desired background color */ margin: 5px; /* or any desired margin */ } ``` In the above code, we have a container with class "container" that contains multiple divs. The container is set to display as flex using `display: flex`. Then, we use `justify-content: flex-end` to align the divs to the right side of the container. Each div has its own width, height, background color, and margin properties defined. Here's an example of how it would look in HTML: ```html
``` This will create a row of divs aligned to the right side of the container.
